ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their robes while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not cover my head while sitting in inhabited areas;’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.4_0: he should not cover his head while sitting in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.11_0: if he has entered his dwelling;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.15_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
